meanings.definition: Any of a class of mainly yellow, orange, or red fat-soluble pigments, including carotenes and xanthophylls, that give color to plant parts such as ripe tomatoes and autumn leaves.
meanings.sent1: The carotenoid in the ripe tomato made it look bright red.
meanings.sent2: Autumn leaves change color due to the presence of carotenoids.
meanings.sent3: The carrot was jealous of the carotenoid in the tomato for being so vibrant.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as radiant as a carotenoid-filled sunset.
meanings.sent5: The carotenoid painted the landscape in warm hues, like a natural artist.

meanings.sent1: The carotenoid added a beautiful orange tint to the painting.
meanings.sent2: The carotenoid pigment enhanced the color of the flower petals.
meanings.sent3: The carotenoid pigment decided to throw a party for all the other pigments.
meanings.sent4: His artwork glowed with the intensity of a carotenoid pigment.
meanings.sent5: The carotenoid pigment danced across the canvas, bringing life to the scene.
